alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 25 at 5:24AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...GUSTY NORTHEASTERLY WINDS WITH AREAS OF BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW POSSIBLE SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY... Another round of strong northeasterly winds is expected to develop across the Matanuska Valley. Winds will increase through Sunday morning, with the strongest winds expected from early afternoon Sunday through Monday morning. During this time, expect sustained winds of 20 to 35 mph with gusts to 55 mph. These winds will persist through Monday morning before slowly diminishing through Monday afternoon and evening. Areas of blowing and drifting snow are expected with the strongest winds; however, significant reductions to visibility are not expected at this time. Please continue to take precautions to protect property. Expect challenging driving conditions in areas of strong winds and blowing and drifting snow. For the latest forecast visit www.weather.gov/afc. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
